strings.Value: "Where are you from?"
"What brought you here?"
"Will you be staying?"
[Give 10 gold] "You travel around... Have you heard anything interesting about my neighbors?"
"Have you heard anything interesting about my neighbors?"
"How are things in Brevoy?"
"Any news from Mivon?"
"What's going on in Pitax?"
"Thank you. That's enough for now."
"Has anyone asked about my lands?"
"Farewell."
"Wait! I want you to meet someone."
"Here! This is Tessie the Quill, a book peddler! If not for her, I'd probably still be sitting in a radish patch in my hometown."
{n}Tessie, a plump woman wearing heavily patched clothes, greets you with a broad, gap-toothed smile.{/n} "Nice to meet you, Your Barony! Thanks for keeping an eye on this little tot!"

"Right now, or in general? Came from {g|Mivon}Mivon{/g} right now. As for in general — well, I'm from everywhere and nowhere. Was found under a bush, and I've traveled with the wind ever since, ha ha!"

"A little bird told me about a proper city in the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g} now, one with a printing house — with an old friend of mine sitting in that printing house, at that! So I came by to see her, maybe buy some books while I'm at it."

"Me? Not really sure. Probably for a while, at least. The people here seem fine. They read, at least — then again, there is a printing house here... And I get to catch up with Linzi — hadn't seen her for a few years, y'know. After I get tired of things here, I'll be on my way again."
{n}Tessie hides the money and smiles knowingly.{/n} "Course I do! Who you want to hear about?"
"Sure! Who you want to hear about?"
"You're always welcome! We peddlers are pretty good at judging rumors, y'know."

"Now, don't you go taking me for a spy, all right? Honestly — go ahead and check me with magic, or just ask Linzi. I'm happy to hear and pass along rumors, but I don't go spying on purpose — my business is books."

"Bad. People in {g|Restov}Restov{/g} are honing their swords. With the royal house gone, it's just a matter of time until there's some big uproar. Everyone knows it, and no one wants it, but there doesn't seem to be any way to avoid it."

"The usual — schemes and duels! Seems a bunch of runaway bandits flooded in there from {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g}. Rumor has it the Great Houses are intentionally straining {g|Mivon}Mivon{/g} so the Aldori there won't be able to help {g|Restov}Restov{/g} when the carnage begins."

"Under King Irovetti, what isn't? Parties, parades, executions... The king robs the trade houses that used to own the city. He brought some gang in from {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g} who's been selling deliriant potions. He sends strange expeditions into nearby lands, but no one knows what he's looking for... Nobody can tell what the kook's thinking — that's why he always wins!"

"As for your question... well, of course they're interested. People in {g|Restov}Restov{/g} want to know if they were right to wager on you, while {g|Mivon}Mivon{/g} and {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g} are still trying to take the measure of their new neighbor. No one knows what to expect from you, so they're getting themselves ready for some surprises!"
"A good day to ya! Take care of Linzi!"
